abstract: For multi-phase intermetallic particles consisting of both θ-and S-phase, de-alloying occurred preferentially at S-phase and the de-alloying of θ-phase initiated in the regions surrounding S-phase. The selective dissolution of Al from θ-phase resulted in porous copper-rich θ-phase remnant, comprised of randomly oriented copper metallic particles and copper oxides with sizes of 10-50 nm. Banding structure developed during the de-alloying of θ-phase particles that contain stacking faults. The de-alloying of θ-phase could preferentially occur from beneath the alloy surface, associated with the local low pH environment generated by trenching of the alloy matrix in the periphery θ-phase particles.

author_highlights.sentence: De-alloying might occur preferentially at S-phase in the multi-phase particles.
The de-alloying of θ-phase resulted in porous copper-rich θ-phase remnant.
Banding structure developed during the de-alloying of θ-phase that contains stacking faults.
The de-alloying of θ-phase could preferentially occur from beneath alloy surface.
